result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joseph L Quandt was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and driver Safety Plan signed and filed.
Court did not object to transfer of probation and condition time to Racine County if that County accepts him.

miscConds.notes:
Fine of $600.00 plus DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements. Cash bail to apply.  Balance by the end of probationary period.  
Should defendant get revoked, sent to prison, monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance would then be paid while on Extended supervision.
Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training if necessary.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens to ensure compliance.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph L Quandt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1/corrected to show defendant WAS found guilty/revocation/aoda, etc.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.
/from Attorney Rothstein submitted on behalf of his client for sentencing, filed.

Defendant Joseph L Quandt in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  All terms and conditions of bail remain the same.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program report filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Defendant Joseph L Quandt in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/20/15.
css

15RM017073  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-02-15

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Joseph L Quandt in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Joseph L Quandt in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Amended Complaint received and filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
